New Records: Colombia extended their unbeaten run to 27 matches with a 5-0 win over Panama.
James Rodríguez scored one goal and set up two others, showcasing his influence on the match.
Colombia's last defeat was in a 1-0 loss to Argentina in February 2022.
Key Match Events: Jhon Córdoba scored the opening goal in the 8th minute with a header from a corner kick.
James Rodríguez converted a penalty in the 15th minute after Panama's goalkeeper Orlando Mosquera fouled Jhon Arias.
Luis Díaz scored from a free-kick in the 41st minute with a lobbed shot over the goalkeeper.
Richard Ríos scored from outside the box in the 70th minute with a low drive that caught the goalkeeper off guard.
Miguel Borja converted a stoppage-time penalty after Panama's José Córdoba fouled Santiago Arias in the box.
Pre-Game Insights: Colombia was favored to win the match based on their performance and expectations.
Post-Match Reflections: James Rodríguez was named Player of the Match for his contributions and leadership.
Panama coach Thomas Christiansen praised his team's effort but acknowledged the 5-0 loss as a tough outcome.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona, with an attendance of 39,740.
The game was covered by FS1 and featured a line of COL -1.5 and an over/under of 2.5.
Others: The match was part of the 2024 Copa América, with Colombia advancing to the semifinals to face Uruguay.
Panama's best performance in the tournament included a memorable 2-1 win over the United States in the group stage.
